response.overview: 83-year-old Héctor García, a renowned photographer, has devoted over 60 years to capturing transcendental moments of Mexico, but especially the day-to-day life of the city he lives in, mostly photographing poverty and marginality. Half a century later, this documentary accompanies photographers Héctor and María García along the center of the city with the purpose of carrying out a tribute and a challenge: to film Mexico D.F. following in the footsteps of García's aesthetics.
response.tagline: Does Mexico exist as portrayed by Héctor García?
response.title: Héctor García, fotógrafo

titles.title: Héctor García: fotógrafo, la foto es la foto

crew.name: Carlos Rodrigo Montes de Oca Rojo
crew.original_name: Carlos Rodrigo Montes de Oca Rojo
